tweets.html:
Tweet your Killing theories before 11PM PST and Include #CaseClosed for your chance to win a Killing Finale Prize Pack!

— The Killing (@TheKilling) June 19, 2011

By 11 pm tonight The Killing will have ended and we'll all be put out of our goddamn misery.

— Amy Ozols (@amyozols) June 19, 2011

Be prepared to be wowed by 'The Killing' tonight. Just sayin'...

— Stuart Levine (@Stus_Views) June 20, 2011

So if #TheKilling reveals that Rosie was killed by her father, possessed by an evil forest spirit named Bob, I'm gonna be really pissed off.

— Jason Mittell (@jmittell) June 20, 2011

Who killed Rosie Larsen? Let's hope we're about to find out. #TheKilling

— Tim (@rural_juror) June 20, 2011

My money's on Rory McIlroy as Rosie Larson's killer.

— Chris (@MrNoncents) June 20, 2011

#TheKilling season finale will leave a rain-shaped hole in my TV schedule. Cant wait to find out if my suspect actually killed Rosie Larsen!

— Danielle Turchiano (@danielletbd) June 20, 2011

It's 9:34. I expect to see the first tweet about the killer in about 24 minutes.

— Chris (@MrNoncents) June 20, 2011

It's like since Rosie died her parents aren't allowed to use high-watt light bulbs anymore. #thekilling

— Sarah Heyward (@shinyunicorn) June 20, 2011

It's raining. #thekilling #finale #spoilers

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) June 20, 2011

Ok. Jaw status: dropped. #thekilling

— Tim (@rural_juror) June 20, 2011

Oh give me a frakkin' break, #TheKilling.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 20, 2011

@sepinwall I hope The Killing's renewal turns out to be a red herring

— Greg M (@obeseball) June 20, 2011

Damn #thekilling. Damn. Damn. Damn. That was a perfect episode. Hate on, haters. Hate. On.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) June 20, 2011

Currently have no more eloquent way to say this: That was really dumb. #Thekilling

— Willa Paskin (@willapaskin) June 20, 2011

Oh. Sigh. #thekilling #finale #spoilers #TeamGameOfThrones

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) June 20, 2011

@DamonLindelof Congratulations. You are now off the hook for a while on the subject of finales that angered people.

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) June 20, 2011

Was the AMC's ending of #TheKilling dif from the original? Cuz I don't remember "Hated it with fury of a 1000 suns" in the Guardian writeup

— Adam Barken (@adambarken) June 20, 2011

Sudenfreude: the pleasure a TV showrunner gets from not giving a crap about viewers. #thekilling

— TVWithoutPity (@TVWithoutPity) June 20, 2011

I don't give a damn about #TheKilling, but I find people's fury over the ending the best show on my Twitter feed right now.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) June 20, 2011

Wow. I'm glad I gave up on #TheKilling weeks ago, because my Twitter feed just projectile vomited.

— Scott Tobias (@scott_tobias) June 20, 2011

From the level of outrage in my Twitter feed right now, I'm assuming #TheKilling ended with someone beheading Sean Bean.

— Tim Carvell (@timcarvell) June 20, 2011

I'm not *angry* about the end of "The Killing," incidentally. Just cold. And wet. And grumpy.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) June 20, 2011

All of this just makes me wish we'd had Twitter for the series finale of the US version of "Life On Mars."

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) June 20, 2011

New theory: #TheKilling takes place inside a snow globe where it's really warm, so the snow's turned into rain.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 20, 2011

Perhaps The Killing should be on Showtime... where nothing ever changes.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) June 20, 2011

Lemme guess: It was Nina Myers. #TheKilling

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) June 20, 2011

I feel like taking the Killing finale and rubbing it hostilely in the face of every single person who insisted it remained a good show.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) June 20, 2011

#TheKilling is basically the new #Damages. Make of that what you will.

— Dan Winclechter (@DWincl) June 20, 2011

New name for #TheKilling: "Cold and Rainy and Boring Case."

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 20, 2011

My biggest problem with #TheKilling continues to be Linden thinking she can show up that late to the airport. Oh and the rest of it.

— Michael O'Connell (@mikeylikestv) June 20, 2011

Wow. So apparently the string of expletives I heard walking home through this warm Chicago evening were @moryan watching #TheKilling finale.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) June 20, 2011

gotta stay off twitter before I accidentally read who won Miss USA, and who killed Rosie Larson. PLEASE LET IT BE THE SAME PERSON.

— Morgan Murphy (@morgan_murphy) June 20, 2011

Tomorrow night's podcast with @moryan will involve #TheKilling discussion. Needless to say, children shouldn't listen.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 20, 2011

Somewhere right now Jennifer Love Hewitt is asking her agents to pitch "I Know What You Did Last Election." #TheKilling

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 20, 2011

@adambarken It's not TV. It's really slow TV. - AMC

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) June 20, 2011

At least now #Rubicon isn't stuck with the worst AMC season finale. #TheKilling

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) June 20, 2011

Guys, if you hear a scream and a tv breaking, that's my anger during #thekilling finale. Just pressed play, expecting violent rage.

— Blerg (@MediaObsessed) June 20, 2011

Here's my takeaway from #TheKilling: it tests viewers to see if you value direction & performance enough to overlook crappy writing (& I do)

— Jason Mittell (@jmittell) June 20, 2011

After reading @sepinwall's Veena Sud interview, I am willing to fund a "Five-Year Old Showrunner of The Killing" Onion video personally.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) June 20, 2011

My guess is that "Rosie" will be the least popular names for new babies this year. Thanks #TheKilling

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) June 20, 2011

#TheKilling Finale has a lower approval rating than George W. Bush when he was in office.

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) June 20, 2011

At this point, I'm willing to buy that Linden killed Rosie Larsen. SHE'S OBSESSED WITH YOUNG GIRLS, ALRIGHT.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) June 20, 2011

ARE WE SURE SHE'S HIS REAL MOM?RT @jmittell: @corybarker Maybe it was Jack, killing Rosie to finally get his mother to pay attention to him!

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) June 20, 2011

Oh Veena Sud, you may have become tv laughing stock tonight. Producing an epically bad finale is a rare gift. #thekilling

— Blerg (@MediaObsessed) June 20, 2011

And anyone griping about #TheKilling finale who hasn't seen season 1 of #VeronicaMars - check it out for how to nail a serialized mystery!

— Jason Mittell (@jmittell) June 20, 2011

FU show, FU. #thekilling Same for you #AMC. Way to destroy your brand in a season.

— Blerg (@MediaObsessed) June 20, 2011

All I heard all season from AMC and the creative team was how after the finale everyone would be talking about #TheKilling - check and mate

— Seat42F (@seat42F) June 20, 2011

I expect the second season of the Killing to end with "And that's how I met your mother."

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) June 20, 2011

I think #TheKilling hate is way off base. Nobody should have been watching for JUST the reveal, and Sud stuck to her vision. Impressive.

— nathan reinhart (@nathanrrr) June 20, 2011

my god, #TheKilling backlash's anti-backlash has already begun. It's a Twitter record.

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) June 20, 2011

The backlash is like a suspect on the show, then? RT @DamianLovesTV: my god, #TheKilling backlash's anti-backlash has already begun.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 20, 2011

Maybe AMC was trying to appease all the haters who bitched the RUBICON finale sucked because it tried to wrap it all up neatly. #TheKilling

— Will Dixon (@wcdixon) June 20, 2011

This is a special time right now, when the Internet gives birth to the loud contrarians who LOVED the finale of AMC's The Killing.

— Bryan Murphy (@Bryan_Murphy) June 20, 2011

Only a few minutes into The Killing but honestly, day 13?! I thought Rosie had been missing for like 8 years!

— Sarah Heyward (@shinyunicorn) June 20, 2011

Angry about The Killing? Take all that energy and watch Luther s1 on Netflix on Demand. Idris Elba makes the bad go away.

— Maggie Furlong (@MaggieFurlong) June 20, 2011

After tonight's #TheKilling I would strongly recommend avoiding the American version of the Stieg Larsson novels. Just a thought.

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) June 20, 2011

I'm sure the holodeck will be fixed in the 2nd season of #TheKilling so Linden & Holder can solve the case & continue on their way to Mars.

— Robert D Sullivan (@RobertDSullivan) June 20, 2011

Um, HBOGO, I don't think you understand. If you don't load this episode I'll be forced to move on to The Killing. THE KILLING!

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) June 20, 2011

I just threw the biggest "I don't wanna watch The Killing" hissy evah.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) June 20, 2011

If there's a TV series named "Psych," can you legally call another Psych!"? Because that wd be a great new title for THE KILLING.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) June 20, 2011
